User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101206 Ubuntu/10.04 (lucid) Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:2.0b10) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b10

For an example of this bug check
http://www.physik.uni-freiburg.de/~janpaki/test2.htm
an load it with Firefox 3.6, 4.0b and Chromium. All look different, while Chromium shows the site as I suppose it to be correct.
1st table is shown correct. 2nd and 3rd table should be on the left hand side with text floating over it. 4th and 5th table should be on the right hand side with text floating over it. 6th and 7th element are <div> and are displayed as wanted. As you see the behaviour isn't symmetric and it depends whether <table> contains a <caption>.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. load http://www.physik.uni-freiburg.de/~janpaki/test2.htm

Actual Results:  
Different behavior of div's and table's containing CSS style information (float, margin, caption). Display of tables are supposed to be wrong.

Expected Results:  
Tables and divs are displayed in the same manner concerning margins and floats. Display of tables shouldn't depend on the use of caption.

Needed to make my custom wikipedia stylesheet work
http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benutzer:Yuszuv/vector.css
